required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quadripolar CRT-D On Currently Approved Lead SystemS
clinical_study.official_title: Quadripolar CRT-D On Currently Approved Lead SystemS

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate different ways to program around extracardiac stimulation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Vectors With Phrenic Nerve Stimulation (PNS)
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of this study was to characterize the performance of Boston Scientific (BSC) unique pacing vectors vs. BSC/St Jude Medical (STJ) common pacing vectors to prevent phrenic nerve stimulation (PNS) based on the selected pacing cathode. BSC unique vectors are those that are only available with Boston Scientific's (BSC) quadripolar (X4) CRT-Ds while common vectors are those that are available for both BSC and STJ systems.

secondary_outcome.description: Characterize the electrical performance of BSC pacing vectors using pacing thresholds. Summary statistics for LV Tip1 to LV Ring 2 pacing thresholds for the BSC pacing vectors were reported. The electrical measurements were taken using the implanted pulse generator (PG) per standard practice.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final LV Lead Impedance at Pre-discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Characterize the electrical performance of BSC pacing vectors using impedance measurements. Summary Statistics Were Provided for LV Tip 1 to LV Ring 2 Measurements. The electrical measurements were taken using the implanted pulse generator (PG) per standard practice.

Characterize the electrical performance of BSC pacing vectors using sensing amplitudes. Summary statistics were provided for LV Tip 1 to LV Ring 2 measurements. The electrical measurements were taken using the implanted pulse generator (PG) per standard practice.

secondary_outcome.measure: Delivery System Comparison Between ACUITY Pro and the Other Delivery Systems
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of implantation (0 to 30 days post consent signature)
secondary_outcome.description: Characterize the performance of the BSC ACUITY Pro delivery system versus competitive delivery systems in the placement of LV leads. Data collected on the use of the ACUITY Pro delivery system and competitive systems were characterized by presenting summary statistics by system (all competitive devices maybe combined for purposes of reporting), and differences between the ACUITY Pro system and competitive systems were reported as appropriate.

arm_group.description: All study patients will be implanted with a Boston Scientific (BSC) quadripolar Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (CRT-D) and a currently approved quadripolar left ventricular lead. At the pre-discharge visit, multiple vectors will be tested in order to assess their respective performance.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects will be selected from the center's general population who are indicated for a CRT-D. All study subjects will be implanted with the BSC DYNAGEN or INOGEN X4 CRT-D (or any future FDA approved BSC X4 CRT-D). Subjects may have a previously implanted/will be receiving an approved quadripolar left ventricular lead.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is medically indicated for implantation with a Boston Scientific (BSC) DYNAGEN or INOGEN X4 CRT-D (or any future FDA approved BSC X4 CRT-D) and already implanted with/scheduled to receive a commercially available quadripolar left ventricular lead
- Subject is willing and capable of providing informed consent and participating in all testing and study visits associated with this investigation at an approved center and at the intervals defined by this protocol
- Subject is age 18 or above, or of legal age to give informed consent specific to state and national law
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a known or suspected sensitivity to dexamethasone acetate (DXA)
- Subject is enrolled in any other concurrent study, without prior approval from BSC
- Women of childbearing potential who are or might be pregnant at the time of study enrollment

overall_official.affiliation: Vanderbilt University Medical Center, Nashville, TN

facility.name: Phoenix Cardiovascular Research Group/ Heart & Vascular Center of Arizona
St. John Hospital and Medical Center
The University of Vermont Medical Center

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 749 subjects were enrolled. Of these, 7 did not complete baseline demographics due to early withdrawals and 1 additional was withdrawn due to LV lead not placed. Therefore, baseline demographics is based on a maximum of 742 subjects.

group.title: All Study Patients
group.description: All study patients were implanted with a BSC quadripolar CRT-D and a currently approved quadripolar left ventricular lead. At the pre-discharge visit, multiple vectors were tested in order to assess their respective performance.

participants_list.participants: Total number of subjects who completed study

baseline.population: Of the 749 enrolled subjects, 742 subjects provided baseline demographics information. Six were early withdrawals and one additional was not implanted with LV lead.

group.title: All Study Patients
group.description: All study patients were implanted with a BSC quadripolar CRT-D and a currently approved quadripolar left ventricular lead. At the pre-discharge visit, multiple vectors were tested in order to assess their respective performance.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) %
measure.population: Number of subjects with this baseline characteristic is smaller than overall population because this information was not collected/provided by the centers for all patients.

measure.title: QRS width
measure.population: Number of subjects with this baseline characteristic is smaller than overall population because this information was not collected/provided by the centers for all patients.

measure.units: Number of Pacing vectors with PNS

outcome.title: Final Pacing Treshold at Pre-discharge
outcome.description: Characterize the electrical performance of BSC pacing vectors using pacing thresholds. Summary statistics for LV Tip1 to LV Ring 2 pacing thresholds for the BSC pacing vectors were reported. The electrical measurements were taken using the implanted pulse generator (PG) per standard practice.

group.description: All study patients were implanted with a BSC quadripolar CRT-D and a currently approved quadripolar left ventricular lead. At the pre-discharge visit, multiple vectors were tested in order to assess their respective performance.

outcome.title: Final LV Lead Impedance at Pre-discharge
outcome.description: Characterize the electrical performance of BSC pacing vectors using impedance measurements. Summary Statistics Were Provided for LV Tip 1 to LV Ring 2 Measurements. The electrical measurements were taken using the implanted pulse generator (PG) per standard practice.

group.title: All Study Patients
group.description: All study patients were implanted with a BSC quadripolar CRT-D and a currently approved quadripolar left ventricular lead. At the pre-discharge visit, multiple vectors were be tested in order to assess their respective performance. Performance of the LV lead delivery system (Acuity Pro vs other LV delivery systems) were assessed. Although use of Acuity Pro was recommended, choice of delivery system was at the physician's discretion.

measure.title: Final LV Lead Impedance at Pre-discharge

class.title: Overall catheter in the body time (min)

reported_events.time_frame: From enrollment through pre-discharge (up to 7 days post-implant). Study was completed at pre-discharge.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
